body: Hi, I just started working with honeybee but I ran into a problem I get 0% of daylight factor all the time, even when using a simple box. Ideally I would like to use also the FRAMES object for shading, but connecting it gives me error My honeybee component is orange - it says I do not have energy plus installed, even after installation I am attaching my file [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/ZuR8thm*Gj-GGeVev5HuQul7O*SSX89nFEJ7xsR0DEhU1zyXIHE1W70USUa-YBKUerMbUwV-BtGcxLHPt74uz-sRFkA5gelI/df.JPG)

replies.body: Hi Mateusz, The problem is because test points are under the floor: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/ZuR8thm*Gj8fyurpTSVjsDbARf-IZlYBS8nNv7Z9aK8etJTEDTpIq1TPIngwgZRZKkazmrOdV-9FGKS8TPozdaNPqw6p--Xp/01_issue.png) you should move your grid up. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/ZuR8thm*Gj*kjLXdhX7BTZqwUwRHd87pZudP*2MS8JrKa-ERb*sdzmHV64nSt3PxxPO9CA7Gsr3g6xkEgmRo*dNAozRknP*H/02.png) You can also connect frames to your model. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/ZuR8thm*Gj-kVzNz3RAxhQvuSGxgFUazKt60YoNFlTGwnEUNEZ6wIZFmosfxGX2h-A7D3ne3Vsq*dtB2IEp3k4rzKm5TBPDC/03.png) Best Antonello
Thank you, I will test it soon. Never thought that I positioned test grid wrong :D
